entry.title: bash saved my day
entry.content:
I was creating an ugly quick-and-dirty script to setup the squid cache_dir automatically with puppet based on the diskspace and memory available.

When you are developing you sometimes forget to create backups and push it git, and mistakes are around the corner.

Lucky bash save my day!

$ ./create_cache_entries.sh >> create_cache_entries.sh -bash: ./create_cache_entries.sh: /bin/bash: bad interpreter: Text file busy $ vi create_cache_entries.sh
